justification: The article states that “The Oxford Risk of Recidivism (OxRec) tool was derived and validated … to estimate the risk of violent reoffending following release from prison,” indicating that OxRec is used to measure (estimate) violent reoffending risk.

It is noted that “the related OASys Violence Predictor (OVP) – is routinely used by probation officers … to assess individual needs and future risks,” tying OVP to assessment of violent reoffending risk.

The manuscript explains that “one risk tool – the Offender Assessment System (OASys)… is routinely used … to assess individual needs and future risks,” showing that OASys operationalises the construct of reoffending risk.
construct: risk of repeat offending / future risk
